questions.qt: Which of the following is part of the Basis and Purpose of the Amateur Radio Service
questions.at1: Providing personal radio communications for as many citizens as possible
questions.at2: Providing communications for international non-profit organizations
questions.at3: Advancing skills in the technical and communication phases of the radio art

questions.qt: Which agency regulates and enforces the rules for the Amateur Radio Service in the United States
What do the FCC rules state regarding the use of a phonetic alphabet for station identification in the Amateur Radio Service
questions.at1: It is required when transmitting emergency messages
questions.at3: It is required when in contact with foreign stations

questions.qt: How many operator/primary station license grants may be held by any one person
questions.at3: One for each band on which the person plans to operate
questions.at4: One for each permanent station location from which the person plans to operate

questions.qt: What proves that the FCC has issued an operator/primary license grant
questions.at1: A printed copy of the certificate of successful completion of examination
questions.at2: An email notification from the NCVEC granting the license
questions.at3: The license appears in the FCC ULS database

questions.qt: What is the FCC Part 97 definition of a beacon
questions.at1: A government transmitter marking the amateur radio band edges
questions.at2: A bulletin sent by the FCC to announce a national emergency
questions.at3: A continuous transmission of weather information authorized in the amateur bands by the National Weather Service
questions.at4: An amateur station transmitting communications for the purposes of observing propagation or related experimental activities

questions.qt: What is the FCC Part 97 definition of a space station
questions.at3: An amateur station located more than 50 km above Earth's surface
questions.at4: An amateur station using amateur radio satellites for relay of signals

questions.qt: Which of the following entities recommends transmit/receive channels and other parameters for auxiliary and repeater stations
questions.at1: Frequency Spectrum Manager appointed by the FCC
questions.at2: Volunteer Frequency Coordinator recognized by local amateurs

questions.qt: Who selects a Frequency Coordinator
questions.at1: The FCC Office of Spectrum Management and Coordination Policy
questions.at2: The local chapter of the Office of National Council of Independent Frequency Coordinators
questions.at3: Amateur operators in a local or regional area whose stations are eligible to be repeater or auxiliary stations

questions.qt: What is the Radio Amateur Civil Emergency Service (RACES)
questions.at1: A radio service using amateur frequencies for emergency management or civil defense communications
questions.at2: A radio service using amateur stations for emergency management or civil defense communications
questions.at3: An emergency service using amateur operators certified by a civil defense organization as being enrolled in that organization

questions.qt: When is willful interference to other amateur radio stations permitted
questions.at1: To stop another amateur station that is breaking the FCC rules
questions.at4: At any time, stations in the Amateur Radio Service are not protected from willful interference

questions.qt: Which of the following frequency ranges are available for phone operation by Technician licensees
Which amateurs may contact the International Space Station (ISS) on VHF bands
questions.at1: Any amateur holding a General class or higher license
questions.at2: Any amateur holding a Technician class or higher license
questions.at3: Any amateur holding a General class or higher license who has applied for and received approval from NASA
questions.at4: Any amateur holding a Technician class or higher license who has applied for and received approval from NASA

questions.qt: Which frequency is in the 6 meter amateur band
Which amateur band includes 146.52 MHz
How may amateurs use the 219 to 220 MHz segment of 1.25 meter band
questions.at4: Fixed digital message forwarding systems only

questions.qt: On which HF bands does a Technician class operator have phone privileges
questions.at3: 80 meter, 40 meter, 15 meter, and 10 meter bands

questions.qt: Which of the following VHF/UHF band segments are limited to CW only
questions.at1: 50.0 MHz to 50.1 MHz and 144.0 MHz to 144.1 MHz
questions.at2: 219 MHz to 220 MHz and 420.0 MHz to 420.1 MHz

questions.qt: How are US amateurs restricted in segments of bands where the Amateur Radio Service is secondary
questions.at1: U.S. amateurs may find non-amateur stations in those segments, and must avoid interfering with them
questions.at2: U.S. amateurs must give foreign amateur stations priority in those segments
questions.at3: International communications are not permitted in those segments
questions.at4: Digital transmissions are not permitted in those segments

questions.qt: Why should you not set your transmit frequency to be exactly at the edge of an amateur band or sub-band
questions.at1: To allow for calibration error in the transmitter frequency display
questions.at2: So that modulation sidebands do not extend beyond the band edge
questions.at3: To allow for transmitter frequency drift

questions.qt: Where may SSB phone be used in amateur bands above 50 MHz
questions.at1: Only in sub-bands allocated to General class or higher licensees
questions.at3: In at least some segment of all these bands
questions.at4: On any band if the power is limited to 25 watts

questions.qt: What is the maximum peak envelope power output for Technician class operators in their HF band segments
Except for some specific restrictions, what is the maximum peak envelope power output for Technician class operators using frequencies above 30 MHz
For which license classes are new licenses currently available from the FCC
questions.at2: Technician, Technician Plus, General, Amateur Extra

questions.qt: Who may select a desired call sign under the vanity call sign rules
questions.at1: Only a licensed amateur with a General or Amateur Extra Class license
questions.at2: Only a licensed amateur with an Amateur Extra Class license
questions.at3: Only a licensed amateur who has been licensed continuously for more than 10 years

questions.qt: What types of international communications are an FCC-licensed amateur radio station permitted to make
questions.at1: Communications incidental to the purposes of the Amateur Radio Service and remarks of a personal character
questions.at2: Communications incidental to conducting business or remarks of a personal nature
questions.at3: Only communications incidental to contest exchanges; all other communications are prohibited
questions.at4: Any communications that would be permitted by an international broadcast station

questions.qt: What may happen if the FCC is unable to reach you by email
questions.at1: Fine and suspension of operator license
questions.at2: Revocation of the station license or suspension of the operator license
questions.at3: Revocation of access to the license record in the FCC system
questions.at4: Nothing; there is no such requirement

questions.qt: Which of the following is a valid Technician class call sign format
From which of the following locations may an FCC-licensed amateur station transmit
questions.at1: From within any country that belongs to the International Telecommunication Union
questions.at2: From within any country that is a member of the United Nations
questions.at3: From anywhere within International Telecommunication Union (ITU) Regions 2 and 3
questions.at4: From any vessel or craft located in international waters and documented or registered in the United States

questions.qt: Which of the following can result in revocation of the station license or suspension of the operator license
questions.at1: Failure to inform the FCC of any changes in the amateur station following performance of an RF safety environmental evaluation
questions.at2: Failure to provide and maintain a correct email address with the FCC
questions.at3: Failure to obtain FCC type acceptance prior to using a home-built transmitter
questions.at4: Failure to have a copy of your license available at your station

questions.qt: What is the normal term for an FCC-issued amateur radio license
What is the grace period for renewal if an amateur license expires
How soon after passing the examination for your first amateur radio license may you transmit on the amateur radio bands
questions.at1: Immediately on receiving your Certificate of Successful Completion of Examination (CSCE)
questions.at2: As soon as your operator/station license grant appears on the ARRL website
questions.at3: As soon as your operator/station license grant appears in the FCC's license database
questions.at4: As soon as you receive your license in the mail from the FCC

questions.qt: If your license has expired and is still within the allowable grace period, may you continue to transmit on the amateur radio bands
questions.at1: Yes, for up to two years
questions.at2: Yes, as soon as you apply for renewal
questions.at3: Yes, for up to one year
questions.at4: No, you must wait until the license has been renewed

questions.qt: With which countries are FCC-licensed amateur radio stations prohibited from exchanging communications
questions.at1: Any country whose administration has notified the International Telecommunication Union (ITU) that it objects to such communications
questions.at2: Any country whose administration has notified the American Radio Relay League (ARRL) that it objects to such communications
questions.at3: Any country banned from such communications by the International Amateur Radio Union (IARU)
questions.at4: Any country banned from making such communications by the American Radio Relay League (ARRL)

questions.qt: Under which of the following circumstances are one-way transmissions by an amateur station prohibited
When is it permissible to transmit messages encoded to obscure their meaning
questions.at2: Only when transmitting certain approved digital codes
questions.at3: Only when transmitting control commands to space stations or radio control craft

questions.qt: Under what conditions is an amateur station authorized to transmit music using a phone emission
questions.at1: When incidental to an authorized retransmission of manned spacecraft communications
questions.at2: When the music produces no spurious emissions
questions.at3: When transmissions are limited to less than three minutes per hour
questions.at4: When the music is transmitted above 1280 MHz

questions.qt: When may amateur radio operators use their stations to notify other amateurs of the availability of equipment for sale or trade
questions.at2: When the equipment is not the personal property of either the station licensee, or the control operator, or their close relatives
questions.at3: When no profit is made on the sale
questions.at4: When selling amateur radio equipment and not on a regular basis

questions.qt: What, if any, are the restrictions concerning transmission of language that may be considered indecent or obscene
questions.at1: The FCC maintains a list of words that are not permitted to be used on amateur frequencies
questions.at3: The ITU maintains a list of words that are not permitted to be used on amateur frequencies

questions.qt: What types of amateur stations can automatically retransmit the signals of other amateur stations
In which of the following circumstances may the control operator of an amateur station receive compensation for operating that station
questions.at1: When the communication is related to the sale of amateur equipment by the control operator's employer
questions.at2: When the communication is incidental to classroom instruction at an educational institution
questions.at3: When the communication is made to obtain emergency information for a local broadcast station

questions.qt: When may amateur stations transmit information in support of broadcasting, program production, or news gathering, assuming no other means is available
questions.at1: When such communications are directly related to the immediate safety of human life or protection of property
questions.at2: When broadcasting communications to or from the space shuttle
questions.at3: Where noncommercial programming is gathered and supplied exclusively to the National Public Radio network

questions.qt: How does the FCC define broadcasting for the Amateur Radio Service
questions.at2: Any transmission made by the licensed station
questions.at3: Transmission of messages directed only to amateur operators
questions.at4: Transmissions intended for reception by the general public

questions.qt: When may an amateur station transmit without identifying on the air
questions.at1: When the transmissions are of a brief nature to make station adjustments
questions.at3: When the transmitted power level is below 1 watt
questions.at4: When transmitting signals to control model craft

questions.qt: When may an amateur station transmit without a control operator
questions.at1: When using automatic control, such as in the case of a repeater
questions.at2: When the station licensee is away and another licensed amateur is using the station
questions.at3: When the transmitting station is an auxiliary station

questions.qt: Who may be the control operator of a station communicating through an amateur satellite or space station
questions.at1: Only an Amateur Extra Class operator
questions.at2: A General class or higher licensee with a satellite operator certification
questions.at3: Only an Amateur Extra Class operator who is also an AMSAT member
questions.at4: Any amateur allowed to transmit on the satellite uplink frequency

questions.qt: Who must designate the station control operator
What determines the transmitting frequency privileges of an amateur station
questions.at1: The frequency authorized by the frequency coordinator
questions.at2: The frequencies printed on the license grant
questions.at3: The highest class of operator license held by anyone on the premises
questions.at4: The class of operator license held by the control operator

questions.qt: What is an amateur station's control point
questions.at1: The location of the station's transmitting antenna
questions.at2: The location of the station's transmitting apparatus
questions.at3: The location at which the control operator function is performed
questions.at4: The mailing address of the station licensee

questions.qt: When, under normal circumstances, may a Technician class licensee be the control operator of a station operating in an Amateur Extra Class band segment
questions.at2: When designated as the control operator by an Amateur Extra Class licensee
questions.at3: As part of a multi-operator contest team
questions.at4: When using a club station whose trustee holds an Amateur Extra Class license

questions.qt: When the control operator is not the station licensee, who is responsible for the proper operation of the station
questions.at1: All licensed amateurs who are present at the operation
questions.at4: The control operator and the station licensee

questions.qt: Which of the following is an example of automatic control
questions.at2: Controlling a station over the internet
questions.at3: Using a computer or other device to send CW automatically
questions.at4: Using a computer or other device to identify automatically

questions.qt: Which of the following are required for remote control operation
questions.at1: The control operator must be at the control point
questions.at2: A control operator is required at all times
questions.at3: The control operator must indirectly manipulate the controls

questions.qt: Which of the following is an example of remote control as defined in Part 97
questions.at2: Operating the station over the internet
questions.at3: Controlling a model aircraft, boat, or car by amateur radio

questions.qt: Who does the FCC presume to be the control operator of an amateur station, unless documentation to the contrary is in the station records
questions.at3: The person operating the station equipment

questions.qt: When must the station and its records be available for FCC inspection
questions.at1: At any time ten days after notification by the FCC of such an inspection
questions.at2: At any time upon request by an FCC representative
questions.at3: At any time after written notification by the FCC of such inspection
questions.at4: Only when presented with a valid warrant by an FCC official or government agent

questions.qt: How often must you identify with your FCC-assigned call sign when using tactical call signs such as "Race Headquarters"
questions.at1: Never, the tactical call is sufficient
questions.at3: At the end of each communication and every ten minutes during a communication
questions.at4: At the end of every transmission

questions.qt: When are you required to transmit your assigned call sign
questions.at1: At the beginning of each contact, and every 10 minutes thereafter
questions.at2: At least once during each transmission
questions.at3: At least every 15 minutes during and at the end of a communication
questions.at4: At least every 10 minutes during and at the end of a communication

questions.qt: What language may you use for identification when operating in a phone sub-band
questions.at1: Any language recognized by the United Nations
questions.at2: Any language recognized by the ITU

questions.qt: What method of call sign identification is required for a station transmitting phone signals
questions.at1: Send the call sign followed by the indicator RPT
questions.at2: Send the call sign using a CW or phone emission
questions.at3: Send the call sign followed by the indicator R
questions.at4: Send the call sign using only a phone emission

questions.qt: Which of the following self-assigned indicators are acceptable when using a phone transmission
Which of the following restrictions apply when a non-licensed person is allowed to speak to a foreign station using a station under the control of a licensed amateur operator
questions.at1: The person must be a U.S. citizen
questions.at2: The foreign station must be in a country with which the U.S. has a third party agreement
questions.at3: The licensed control operator must do the station identification

questions.qt: What is the definition of third party communications
questions.at1: A message from a control operator to another amateur station control operator on behalf of another person
questions.at2: Amateur radio communications where three stations are in communications with one another
questions.at3: Operation when the transmitting equipment is licensed to a person other than the control operator
questions.at4: Temporary authorization for an unlicensed person to transmit on the amateur bands for technical experiments

questions.qt: What type of amateur station simultaneously retransmits the signal of another amateur station on a different channel or channels
Who is accountable if a repeater inadvertently retransmits communications that violate the FCC rules
questions.at1: The control operator of the originating station
questions.at2: The control operator of the repeater
questions.at4: Both the originating station and the repeater owner

questions.qt: Which of the following is a requirement for the issuance of a club station license grant
questions.at1: The trustee must have an Amateur Extra Class operator license grant
questions.at2: The club must have at least four members
questions.at3: The club must be registered with the American Radio Relay League

questions.qt: What is a common repeater frequency offset in the 2 meter band
What is the national calling frequency for FM simplex operations in the 2 meter band
What is a common repeater frequency offset in the 70 cm band
What is an appropriate way to call another station on a repeater if you know the other station's call sign
questions.at1: Say "break, break," then say the station's call sign
questions.at2: Say the station's call sign, then identify with your call sign
questions.at3: Say "CQ" three times, then the other station's call sign
questions.at4: Wait for the station to call CQ, then answer

questions.qt: How should you respond to a station calling CQ
questions.at1: Transmit "CQ" followed by the other station's call sign
questions.at2: Transmit your call sign followed by the other station's call sign
questions.at3: Transmit the other station's call sign followed by your call sign
questions.at4: Transmit a signal report followed by your call sign

questions.qt: Which of the following is required when making on-the-air test transmissions
questions.at2: Conduct tests only between 10 p.m. and 6 a.m. local time
questions.at3: Notify the FCC of the transmissions

questions.qt: What is meant by "repeater offset"
questions.at1: The difference between a repeater's transmit and receive frequencies
questions.at2: The repeater has a time delay to prevent interference
questions.at3: The repeater station identification is done on a separate frequency
questions.at4: The number of simultaneous transmit frequencies used by a repeater

questions.qt: What is the meaning of the procedural signal "CQ"
questions.at3: Only the called station should transmit

questions.qt: Which of the following indicates that a station is listening on a repeater and looking for a contact
questions.at1: "CQ CQ" followed by the repeater's call sign
questions.at2: The station's call sign followed by the word "monitoring"
questions.at3: The repeater call sign followed by the station's call sign

questions.qt: What is a band plan, beyond the privileges established by the FCC
questions.at1: A voluntary guideline for using different modes or activities within an amateur band
questions.at3: A list of available net frequencies
questions.at4: A plan devised by a club to indicate frequency band usage

questions.qt: What term describes an amateur station that is transmitting and receiving on the same frequency
What should you do before calling CQ
questions.at1: Listen first to be sure that no one else is using the frequency
questions.at2: Ask if the frequency is in use
questions.at3: Make sure you are authorized to use that frequency

questions.qt: How is a VHF/UHF transceiver's "reverse" function used
questions.at3: To listen on a repeater's input frequency
questions.at4: To listen on a repeater's output frequency

questions.qt: What term describes the use of a sub-audible tone transmitted along with normal voice audio to open the squelch of a receiver
Which of the following describes a linked repeater network
questions.at1: A network of repeaters in which signals received by one repeater are transmitted by all the repeaters in the network
questions.at2: A single repeater with more than one receiver
questions.at3: Multiple repeaters with the same control operator
questions.at4: A system of repeaters linked by APRS

questions.qt: Which of the following could be the reason you are unable to access a repeater whose output you can hear
questions.at2: You are using the wrong CTCSS tone
questions.at3: You are using the wrong DCS code

questions.qt: What would cause your FM transmission audio to be distorted on voice peaks
questions.at4: Your transmit power is too high

questions.qt: What type of signaling uses pairs of audio tones
How can you join a digital repeater's "talkgroup"
questions.at1: Register your radio with the local FCC office
questions.at3: Program your radio with the group's ID or code
questions.at4: Sign your call after the courtesy tone

questions.qt: Which of the following applies when two stations transmitting on the same frequency interfere with each other
questions.at1: The stations should negotiate continued use of the frequency
questions.at2: Both stations should choose another frequency to avoid conflict
questions.at3: Interference is inevitable, so no action is required
questions.at4: Use subaudible tones so both stations can share the frequency

questions.qt: Why are simplex channels designated in the VHF/UHF band plans
questions.at1: So stations within range of each other can communicate without tying up a repeater
questions.at4: So stations with simple transmitters can access the repeater without automated offset

questions.qt: Which Q signal indicates that you are receiving interference from other stations
Which Q signal indicates that you are changing frequency
What is the purpose of the color code used on DMR repeater systems
questions.at1: Must match the repeater color code for access
questions.at2: Defines the frequency pair to use
questions.at4: Defines the minimum signal level required for access

questions.qt: What is the purpose of a squelch function
questions.at1: Reduce a CW transmitter's key clicks
questions.at2: Mute the receiver audio when a signal is not present
questions.at3: Eliminate parasitic oscillations in an RF amplifier

questions.qt: When do FCC rules NOT apply to the operation of an amateur station
questions.at2: When operating under special FEMA rules
questions.at3: When operating under special ARES rules

questions.qt: Which of the following are typical duties of a Net Control Station
questions.at1: Choose the regular net meeting time and frequency
questions.at2: Ensure that all stations checking into the net are properly licensed for operation on the net frequency
questions.at3: Call the net to order and direct communications between stations checking in

questions.qt: What technique is used to ensure that voice messages containing unusual words are received correctly
questions.at1: Send the words by voice and Morse code
questions.at2: Speak very loudly into the microphone
questions.at3: Spell the words using a standard phonetic alphabet

questions.qt: What is RACES
questions.at1: An emergency organization combining amateur radio and citizens band operators and frequencies
questions.at3: A radio contest held in a short period, sometimes called a "sprint"
questions.at4: An FCC part 97 amateur radio service for civil defense communications during national emergencies

questions.qt: What does the term "traffic" refer to in net operation
questions.at2: The number of stations checking in and out of a net
questions.at3: Operation by mobile or portable stations
questions.at4: Requests to activate the net by a served agency

questions.qt: What is the Amateur Radio Emergency Service (ARES)
questions.at1: A group of licensed amateurs who have voluntarily registered their qualifications and equipment for communications duty in the public service
questions.at2: A group of licensed amateurs who are members of the military and who voluntarily agreed to provide message handling services in the case of an emergency
questions.at3: A training program that provides licensing courses for those interested in obtaining an amateur license to use during emergencies
questions.at4: A training program that certifies amateur operators for membership in the Radio Amateur Civil Emergency Service

questions.qt: Which of the following is standard practice when you participate in a net
questions.at1: When first responding to the net control station, transmit your call sign, name, and address as in the FCC database
questions.at2: Record the time of each of your transmissions
questions.at3: Unless you are reporting an emergency, transmit only when directed by the net control station

questions.qt: Which of the following is a characteristic of good traffic handling
questions.at2: Making decisions as to whether messages are worthy of relay or delivery
questions.at3: Ensuring that any newsworthy messages are relayed to the news media

questions.qt: Are amateur station control operators ever permitted to operate outside the frequency privileges of their license class
questions.at2: Yes, but only when part of a FEMA emergency plan
questions.at3: Yes, but only when part of a RACES emergency plan
questions.at4: Yes, but only in situations involving the immediate safety of human life or protection of property

questions.qt: What information is contained in the preamble of a formal traffic message
questions.at1: The email address of the originating station
questions.at2: The address of the intended recipient
questions.at3: The telephone number of the addressee
questions.at4: Information needed to track the message

questions.qt: What is meant by "check" in a radiogram header
questions.at1: The number of words or word equivalents in the text portion of the message
questions.at2: The call sign of the originating station
questions.at3: A list of stations that have relayed the message
questions.at4: A box on the message form that indicates that the message was received and/or relayed

questions.qt: Why do VHF signal strengths sometimes vary greatly when the antenna is moved only a few feet
questions.at1: The signal path encounters different concentrations of water vapor
questions.at2: VHF ionospheric propagation is very sensitive to path length
questions.at3: Multipath propagation cancels or reinforces signals

questions.qt: What is the effect of vegetation on UHF and microwave signals
What antenna polarization is normally used for long-distance CW and SSB contacts on the VHF and UHF bands
What happens when antennas at opposite ends of a VHF or UHF line of sight radio link are not using the same polarization
questions.at1: The modulation sidebands might become inverted

questions.qt: When using a directional antenna, how might your station be able to communicate with a distant repeater if buildings or obstructions are blocking the direct line of sight path
questions.at1: Change from vertical to horizontal polarization
questions.at2: Try to find a path that reflects signals to the repeater
questions.at4: Increase the antenna Standing Wave Ratio (SWR)

questions.qt: What is the meaning of the term "picket fencing"
questions.at1: Alternating transmissions during a net operation
questions.at2: Rapid flutter on mobile signals due to multipath propagation
questions.at3: A type of ground system used with vertical antennas

questions.qt: What weather condition might decrease range at microwave frequencies
What is a likely cause of irregular fading of signals propagated by the ionosphere
questions.at1: Frequency shift due to Faraday rotation
questions.at4: Random combining of signals arriving via different paths

questions.qt: Which of the following results from the fact that signals propagated by the ionosphere are elliptically polarized
questions.at2: Either vertically or horizontally polarized antennas may be used for transmission or reception
questions.at4: Both the transmitting and receiving antennas must be of the same polarization

questions.qt: What effect does multi-path propagation have on data transmissions
questions.at1: Transmission rates must be increased by a factor equal to the number of separate paths observed
questions.at2: Transmission rates must be decreased by a factor equal to the number of separate paths observed
questions.at3: No significant changes will occur if the signals are transmitted using FM
questions.at4: Error rates are likely to increase

questions.qt: Which region of the atmosphere can refract or bend HF and VHF radio waves
What is the effect of fog and rain on signals in the 10 meter and 6 meter bands
What is the relationship between the electric and magnetic fields of an electromagnetic wave
What property of a radio wave defines its polarization
questions.at1: The orientation of the electric field
questions.at2: The orientation of the magnetic field
questions.at3: The ratio of the energy in the magnetic field to the energy in the electric field
questions.at4: The ratio of the velocity to the wavelength

questions.qt: What are the two components of a radio wave
What is the velocity of a radio wave traveling through free space
questions.at3: Speed inversely proportional to its wavelength
questions.at4: Speed that increases as the frequency increases

questions.qt: What is the relationship between wavelength and frequency
questions.at1: Wavelength gets longer as frequency increases
questions.at2: Wavelength gets shorter as frequency increases
questions.at4: Wavelength and frequency increase as path length increases

questions.qt: What is the formula for converting frequency to approximate wavelength in meters
questions.at1: Wavelength in meters equals frequency in hertz multiplied by 300
questions.at2: Wavelength in meters equals frequency in hertz divided by 300
questions.at3: Wavelength in meters equals frequency in megahertz divided by 300
questions.at4: Wavelength in meters equals 300 divided by frequency in megahertz

questions.qt: In addition to frequency, which of the following is used to identify amateur radio bands
What frequency range is referred to as VHF
What frequency range is referred to as UHF
What frequency range is referred to as HF
What is the approximate velocity of a radio wave in free space
Why are simplex UHF signals rarely heard beyond their radio horizon
questions.at1: They are too weak to go very far
questions.at2: FCC regulations prohibit them from going more than 50 miles
questions.at3: UHF signals are usually not propagated by the ionosphere
questions.at4: UHF signals are absorbed by the ionospheric D region

questions.qt: What is a characteristic of HF communication compared with communications on VHF and higher frequencies
questions.at3: Long-distance ionospheric propagation is far more common on HF
questions.at4: There is less atmospheric interference (static) on HF

questions.qt: What is a characteristic of VHF signals received via auroral backscatter
questions.at1: They are often received from 10,000 miles or more
questions.at2: They are distorted and signal strength varies considerably
questions.at3: They occur only during winter nighttime hours
questions.at4: They are generally strongest when your antenna is aimed west

questions.qt: Which of the following types of propagation is most commonly associated with occasional strong signals on the 10, 6, and 2 meter bands from beyond the radio horizon
Which of the following effects may allow radio signals to travel beyond obstructions between the transmitting and receiving stations
What type of propagation is responsible for allowing over-the-horizon VHF and UHF communications to ranges of approximately 300 miles on a regular basis
What band is best suited for communicating via meteor scatter
What causes tropospheric ducting
questions.at1: Discharges of lightning during electrical storms

questions.qt: What is generally the best time for long-distance 10 meter band propagation via the F region
questions.at1: From dawn to shortly after sunset during periods of high sunspot activity
questions.at2: From shortly after sunset to dawn during periods of high sunspot activity
questions.at3: From dawn to shortly after sunset during periods of low sunspot activity
questions.at4: From shortly after sunset to dawn during periods of low sunspot activity

questions.qt: Which of the following bands may provide long-distance communications via the ionosphere's F region during the peak of the sunspot cycle
Why is the radio horizon for VHF and UHF signals more distant than the visual horizon
questions.at1: Radio signals move somewhat faster than the speed of light
questions.at2: Radio waves are not blocked by dust particles
questions.at3: The atmosphere refracts radio waves slightly
questions.at4: Radio waves are blocked by dust particles

questions.qt: Which of the following is an appropriate power supply rating for a typical 50 watt output mobile FM transceiver
Which of the following should be considered when selecting an accessory Standing Wave Ratio (SWR) meter
questions.at1: The frequency and power level at which the measurements will be made
questions.at2: The distance that the meter will be located from the antenna
questions.at3: The types of modulation being used at the station

questions.qt: What is an advantage of a 5/8 wavelength whip antenna for VHF or UHF mobile service
questions.at1: It has more gain than a 1/4-wavelength antenna
questions.at2: It radiates at a very high angle
questions.at3: It eliminates distortion caused by reflected signals
questions.at4: It has 10 times the power gain of a 1/4 wavelength whip

questions.qt: What is a benefit of low Standing Wave Ratio (SWR)
What is the most common impedance of coaxial cables used in amateur radio
Why is coaxial cable the most common feed line for amateur radio antenna systems
questions.at1: It is easy to use and requires few special installation considerations
questions.at2: It has less loss than any other type of feed line
questions.at3: It can handle more power than any other type of feed line
questions.at4: It is less expensive than any other type of feed line

questions.qt: What is the major function of an antenna tuner (antenna coupler)
questions.at1: It matches the antenna system impedance to the transceiver's output impedance
questions.at2: It helps a receiver automatically tune in weak stations
questions.at3: It allows an antenna to be used on both transmit and receive
questions.at4: It automatically selects the proper antenna for the frequency band being used

questions.qt: What happens as the frequency of a signal in coaxial cable is increased
Which of the following RF connector types is most suitable for frequencies above 400 MHz
Which of the following is true of PL-259 type coax connectors
questions.at1: They are preferred for microwave operation
questions.at3: They are commonly used at HF and VHF frequencies

questions.qt: Which of the following is a source of loss in coaxial feed line
What can cause erratic changes in Standing Wave Ratio (SWR)
questions.at2: Loose connection in the antenna or feed line
questions.at4: Overload from a strong local station

questions.qt: What is the electrical difference between RG-58 and RG-213 coaxial cable
questions.at1: There is no significant difference between the two types
questions.at3: RG-213 cable has less loss at a given frequency
questions.at4: RG-58 cable can handle higher power levels

questions.qt: Which of the following types of feed line has the lowest loss at VHF and UHF
What is standing wave ratio (Standing Wave Ratio (SWR))
questions.at1: A measure of how well a load is matched to a transmission line
questions.at2: The ratio of amplifier power output to input
questions.at4: An indication of the quality of your station's ground connection

questions.qt: Which of the following is a safety hazard of a 12-volt storage battery
questions.at1: Touching both terminals with the hands can cause electrical shock
questions.at2: Shorting the terminals can cause burns, fire, or an explosion
questions.at3: RF emissions from a nearby transmitter can cause the electrolyte to emit poison gas

questions.qt: What health hazard is presented by electrical current flowing through the body
questions.at1: It may cause injury by heating tissue
questions.at2: It may disrupt the electrical functions of cells
questions.at3: It may cause involuntary muscle contractions

questions.qt: In the United States, what circuit does black wire insulation indicate in a three-wire 120 V cable
What is the purpose of a fuse in an electrical circuit
questions.at1: To prevent power supply ripple from damaging a component
questions.at2: To remove power in case of overload
questions.at3: To limit current to prevent shocks

questions.qt: Why should a 5-ampere fuse never be replaced with a 20-ampere fuse
questions.at1: The larger fuse would be likely to blow because it is rated for higher current
questions.at2: The power supply ripple would greatly increase
questions.at3: Excessive current could cause a fire

questions.qt: What is a good way to guard against electrical shock at your station
questions.at1: Use three-wire cords and plugs for all AC powered equipment
questions.at2: Connect all AC powered station equipment to a common safety ground
questions.at3: Install mechanical interlocks in high-voltage circuits

questions.qt: Where should a lightning arrester be installed in a coaxial feed line
questions.at1: At the output connector of a transceiver
questions.at3: At the ac power service panel
questions.at4: On a grounded panel near where feed lines enter the building

questions.qt: Where should a fuse or circuit breaker be installed in a 120V AC power circuit
questions.at1: In series with the hot conductor only
questions.at2: In series with the hot and neutral conductors
questions.at3: In parallel with the hot conductor only
questions.at4: In parallel with the hot and neutral conductors

questions.qt: What should be done to all external ground rods or earth connections
questions.at1: Waterproof them with silicone caulk or electrical tape
questions.at2: Keep them as far apart as possible
questions.at3: Bond them together with heavy wire or conductive strap
questions.at4: Tune them for resonance on the lowest frequency of operation

questions.qt: What hazard is caused by charging or discharging a battery too quickly
What hazard exists in a power supply immediately after turning it off
questions.at1: Circulating currents in the dc filter
questions.at2: Leakage flux in the power transformer

questions.qt: Which of the following precautions should be taken when measuring high voltages with a voltmeter
questions.at1: Ensure that the voltmeter has very low impedance
questions.at2: Ensure that the voltmeter and leads are rated for use at the voltages to be measured
questions.at3: Ensure that the circuit is grounded through the voltmeter
questions.at4: Ensure that the voltmeter is set to the correct frequency

questions.qt: Which of the following is good practice when installing ground wires on a tower for lightning protection
questions.at1: Put a drip loop in the ground connection to prevent water damage to the ground system
questions.at2: Make sure all ground wire bends are right angles
questions.at3: Ensure that connections are short and direct

questions.qt: What is required when climbing an antenna tower
questions.at1: Have sufficient training on safe tower climbing techniques
questions.at2: Use appropriate tie-off to the tower at all times
questions.at3: Always wear an approved climbing harness

questions.qt: Under what circumstances is it safe to climb a tower without a helper or observer
questions.at1: When no electrical work is being performed
questions.at2: When no mechanical work is being performed
questions.at3: When the work being done is not more than 20 feet above the ground

questions.qt: Which of the following is an important safety precaution to observe when putting up an antenna tower
questions.at1: Wear a ground strap connected to your wrist at all times
questions.at2: Insulate the base of the tower to avoid lightning strikes
questions.at3: Look for and stay clear of any overhead electrical wires

questions.qt: What is the purpose of a safety wire through a turnbuckle used to tension guy lines
questions.at1: Secure the guy line if the turnbuckle breaks
questions.at2: Prevent loosening of the turnbuckle from vibration
questions.at3: Provide a ground path for lightning strikes
questions.at4: Provide an ability to measure for proper tensioning

questions.qt: What is the minimum safe distance from a power line to allow when installing an antenna
questions.at1: Add the height of the antenna to the height of the power line and multiply by a factor of 1.5
questions.at2: The height of the power line above ground
questions.at4: Enough so that if the antenna falls, no part of it can come closer than 10 feet to the power wires

questions.qt: Which of the following is an important safety rule to remember when using a crank-up tower
questions.at1: This type of tower must never be painted
questions.at2: This type of tower must never be grounded
questions.at3: This type of tower must not be climbed unless it is retracted, or mechanical safety locking devices have been installed

questions.qt: Which is a proper grounding method for a tower
questions.at1: A single four-foot ground rod, driven into the ground no more than 12 inches from the base
questions.at2: A ferrite-core RF choke connected between the tower and ground
questions.at3: A connection between the tower base and a cold water pipe
questions.at4: Separate eight-foot ground rods for each tower leg, bonded to the tower and each other

questions.qt: Why should you avoid attaching an antenna to a utility pole
questions.at1: The antenna will not work properly because of induced voltages
questions.at2: The 60 Hz radiations from the feed line may increase the Standing Wave Ratio (SWR)
questions.at3: The antenna could contact high-voltage power lines

questions.qt: Which of the following is true when installing grounding conductors used for lightning protection
questions.at2: Wires must be carefully routed with precise right-angle bends

questions.qt: Which of the following establishes grounding requirements for an amateur radio tower or antenna
What type of radiation are radio signals
At which of the following frequencies does maximum permissible exposure have the lowest value
How does the allowable power density for RF safety change if duty cycle changes from 100 percent to 50 percent
questions.at1: It increases by a factor of 3
questions.at3: It increases by a factor of 2
questions.at4: There is no adjustment allowed for lower duty cycle

questions.qt: What factors affect the RF exposure of people near an amateur station antenna
questions.at1: Frequency and power level of the RF field
questions.at2: Distance from the antenna to a person

questions.qt: Why do exposure limits vary with frequency
questions.at1: Lower frequency RF fields have more energy than higher frequency fields
questions.at2: Lower frequency RF fields do not penetrate the human body
questions.at3: Higher frequency RF fields are transient in nature
questions.at4: The human body absorbs more RF energy at some frequencies than at others

questions.qt: Which of the following is an acceptable method to determine whether your station complies with FCC RF exposure regulations
questions.at1: By calculation based on FCC OET Bulletin 65
questions.at2: By calculation based on computer modeling
questions.at3: By measurement of field strength using calibrated equipment

questions.qt: What hazard is created by touching an antenna during a transmission
Which of the following actions can reduce exposure to RF radiation
How can you make sure your station stays in compliance with RF safety regulations
questions.at1: By informing the FCC of any changes made in your station
questions.at2: By re-evaluating the station whenever an item in the transmitter or antenna system is changed
questions.at3: By making sure your antennas have low Standing Wave Ratio (SWR)

questions.qt: Why is duty cycle one of the factors used to determine safe RF radiation exposure levels
questions.at1: It affects the average exposure to radiation
questions.at2: It affects the peak exposure to radiation
questions.at3: It takes into account the antenna feed line loss
questions.at4: It takes into account the thermal effects of the final amplifier

questions.qt: What is the definition of duty cycle during the averaging time for RF exposure
questions.at1: The difference between the lowest power output and the highest power output of a transmitter
questions.at2: The difference between the PEP and average power output of a transmitter
questions.at3: The percentage of time that a transmitter is transmitting
questions.at4: The percentage of time that a transmitter is not transmitting

questions.qt: How does RF radiation differ from ionizing radiation (radioactivity)
questions.at1: RF radiation does not have sufficient energy to cause chemical changes in cells and damage DNA
questions.at2: RF radiation can only be detected with an RF dosimeter
questions.at3: RF radiation is limited in range to a few feet

questions.qt: Who is responsible for ensuring that no person is exposed to RF energy above the FCC exposure limits
questions.at3: Anyone who is near an antenna
